title: Deepti, Amanjot fire as India crush Sri Lanka in Women’s World Cup opener
byline: A splendid all-round display saw India launch their ICC Women’s World Cup campaign on the front foot, brushing aside Sri Lanka by 59 runs in the curtain-raiser in Guwahati on Tuesday.

title: Deadly 6.9 magnitude earthquake strikes central Philippines
byline: A powerful 6.9-magnitude earthquake struck the central Philippines late Tuesday, killing people at a sports arena and raising fears of considerable destruction.

title: CID arrests suspect in Rs. 100M ‘Urumaya’ scam
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has arrested a suspect connected to a massive ‘Urumaya’ deed certificate scam that defrauded over Rs. 100 million from hundreds of victims in the Eastern Province.

title: CAA warns public to report overpriced food at bus stop restaurants
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has urged the public to report instances of food and beverages being sold at prices higher than the stated rates at restaurants where long-distance buses stop for tea. Reports can be made via the CAA’s “1977” SMS service.

title: New Vithanakanda Tea Factory CEO returns after record-breaking sale
byline: The FF Extra Special Black Tea, presented by the New Vithanakanda Tea Factory and recognized by the Guinness World Records as the most valuable and expensive tea in the world, was successfully sold at an international auction. CEO Pubudu Gunasekara, who participated in the auction, arrived at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) this morning.

title: Former policeman sentenced to 14 years for child sexual abuse
byline: Homagama High Court Judge Navaratna Marasinghe sentenced a former Borella police officer, who had been indicted for sexually abusing a girl under the age of 16, to 14 years of rigorous imprisonment.

title: U.S. sanctions stand in the way of realising Russia–Sri Lanka trade, tourism potential fully: Envoy
byline: The full potential of Russia–Sri Lanka bilateral trade and tourism cannot be realised because of U.S. sanctions, Russian Ambassador Levan Dzhagaryan said yesterday.

title: Nine months on: US $3.7Bn Sinopec investment in limbo
byline: Despite the lapse of nine months since the signing of the MoU, the government is yet to finalise the proposed US $3.7 billion investment by China’s Sinopec for a refinery facility in Hambantota, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: President returns from official Japan visit
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who was on an official visit to Japan, arrived at Katunayake Airport this morning (10) after completing his trip, airport officials confirmed.

title: Matara station lacks timetable announcements, Frustrates commuters
byline: Commuters at Matara Railway Station have expressed frustration over the lack of announcements regarding train schedules.

title: ‘Tinker’ deported from Dubai, arrested at BIA
byline: Sridharan Niranjan, also known as ‘Tinker,’ who was deported from Dubai, was taken into custody by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) this morning.

title: Rugby World Cup draw set for December 3
byline: The draw for an expanded 2027 Rugby World Cup will take place on December 3, organisers said Wednesday, with hosts Australia confirmed as kicking off the tournament at Perth Stadium.

title: India-Sri Lanka CWC25 opener sets new attendance record
byline: The ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025 got off to a historic start in Guwahati with the opener between India and Sri Lanka setting a new opening day attendance record at any Women’s Cricket World Cup.

title: US cities should be military training grounds, Trump tells generals
byline: US President Donald Trump has said he wants to use American cities as ’’training grounds’’ for the military.

title: TID recovers 10 hand grenades; Hunt on for more
byline: The Terrorist Investigation Division (TID), probing suspects who fled with 100 hand grenades, recovered 10 of them in Modara yesterday.

title: Passport, visa services continue despite US funding gap
byline: Passport and visa services in the United States and at U.S. Embassies and Consulates overseas will continue during the lapse in appropriations, the U.S. Embassy in Colombo announced.

title: US government shuts down after Democrats refuse to back Republican funding plan
byline: The US government shut down on Wednesday, after congressional Democrats refused to support a Republican plan to extend funding for federal departments unless they won a series of concessions centered on healthcare.

title: Sri Lanka grants first individual investor residence visa
byline: Sri Lanka has issued its first residence visa under the Individual Investor Category, introduced under the amended Immigration and Emigration Regulations (Extraordinary Gazette No. 2360/24 dated 27 November 2023).

title: CSE kicks off october on a positive note amid robust turnover
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) opened October with sustained positive momentum, supported by a robust turnover of LKR 6.46 Bn.

title: Public assistance sought to find Pakistani national wanted over drug smuggling
byline: The Police have sought public assistance to find a Pakistani national wanted over smuggling of more than 111 kilograms of heroin into Sri Lanka in 2016.

title: Crimes like Thajudeen’s murder not committed by Siripala or Gnanaratnam in the village: Bimal
byline: Crimes like the murder of Wasim Thajudeen were not committed by Siripala or Gnanaratnam in the village, but by rulers who governed the country, Minister Bimal Ratnayake said today.

title: Weligama Municipal Council officials protest over alleged threats by Deputy Chairman
byline: Officials of the Weligama Municipal Council refrained from performing their duties, claiming that Deputy Chairman Arindra Sanath Kumara had threatened the Municipal Council Accountant, a senior official said.

title: Decision on bus fare revision tomorrow: Bimal
byline: The government will reveal by tomorrow whether the bus fare can be reduced as per the recent fuel price reduction, Transport Minister Bimal Ratnayakae said.

title: Teaching service recruitment awaiting Appeal Court verdict
byline: The Education Ministry said that several Supreme Court cases concerning the competitive examination held on March 25, 2023, for the admission of graduate officers in government services, including development officers working in schools — into the teaching service, have been concluded.

title: Opposition will intervene to safeguard agriculture in Sri Lanka: Sajith
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa on Tuesday pledged the full support of the Opposition to revitalise and protect Sri Lanka’s agricultural sector.

title: Anuradhapura set to become first district to eradicate rabies: Dr. Nanayakkara
byline: Anuradhapura will soon be recognized as the first district in Sri Lanka to eradicate rabies, with the district’s flag set to be hoisted to mark the milestone, Animal Welfare Coalition (AWC) Executive Committee Member Dr. Chamith Nanayakkara announced.

title: Politicisation of Thajudeen’s death an insult to his departed soul: Namal
byline: SLPP MP Namal Rajapaksa said the government should conduct an impartial and comprehensive investigation into the death of former rugby player Wasim Thajudeen without trying to make it a political slogan for its ends and otherwise, it would be an insult to his departed soul.

title: Ministry submits bill to ban corporal punishment of children
byline: The Women and Child Affairs Ministry has submitted a bill to Parliament seeking to amend the Penal Code to address the corporal punishment of children, the Education Ministry said.

title: Teacher assaulted by student in Moneragala
byline: A teacher of a leading school in Moneragala town was assualted by a Grade Elevan student today and was hospitalised.

title: Probe launched after stock of weapons found near Weheragala reservoir
byline: Kataragama Police have launched an investigation after a stock of weapons was discovered near the sluice gate of the Weheragala Reservoir.

title: South African ambassador found dead in Paris
byline: The police are investigating the death of South Africa’s ambassador to France as a possible suicide, after he was found dead outside a Paris hotel on Tuesday, according to the French authorities.

title: LAUGFS gas domestic cylinder prices remain unchanged
byline: LAUGFS Gas announced that there will be no price revision for domestic gas cylinder refills in October.

title: Father lodges complaint after son suffers brain damage in Colombo Swimming Club pool
byline: The father of an eight-year-old boy has lodged a complaint against the Colombo Swimming Club, alleging negligence after his son fell into the pool and suffered brain damage.

title: Three-wheeler registration made mandatory in Western Province from today
byline: The registration of three-wheelers used for passenger transport in the Western Province has been made mandatory from today, according to the National Three-Wheeler Association of Sri Lanka Self-Employed Professionals.

title: US cities should be military training grounds, Trump tells generals
byline: US President Donald Trump has said he wants to use American cities as ’’training grounds’’ for the military.

title: US government shuts down after Democrats refuse to back Republican funding plan
byline: The US government shut down on Wednesday, after congressional Democrats refused to support a Republican plan to extend funding for federal departments unless they won a series of concessions centered on healthcare.

title: Tamim Iqbal withdraws nomination from BCB elections
byline: Former Bangladesh skipper Tamim Iqbal has withdrawn his candidature from the upcoming Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) election, scheduled for October 6.

title: Fresh warning issued on WhatsApp & online fraud risks
byline: The Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (SLCERT) has urged the public not to join unknown WhatsApp groups, avoid engaging in financial transactions with strangers, and refrain from purchasing goods from unverified sources.
